name: Casa Moderna Miami

reviews.text: Great Stay, well placed, enormous comfort!
reviews.title: Great Stay, well placed, enormous confort

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel in feb./2013 for four nights.
reviews.title: Perfect spot close to venue

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is excellent, just a feel blocks from the American Express Arena and The Bayside Market.
reviews.title: VERY average pricey hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room amenities are very good, the shower has a vintage tub that really works the water pressure is ok.
reviews.title: Hello? Are you there?

reviews.text: Room and balcony size are generous, 42' LCD TV, Blueray and cable, closet, minibar and sink..
reviews.title: really really nice rooms!

reviews.text: Although the reservation was through a friend of mine, I'd still like to share my review. Location was not bad, although you are about a 15-20 minute drive from south beach, you didn't feel disconnected from everything. You're located right next to American Airlines Arena and the Bayside shopping and restaurant area. The hotel itself is very clean and modern. We only stayed for one night and the beds were super comfortable. Only mishap is they only provide valet parking. It was $32.00 dollars and that price was charged to the room. It is for unlimited/24 hour service. Being that we only stayed one night, Idk if it's for your whole stay or per day price. Be prepared if you are traveling with other people, other than your immediate family, the bathroom is open to the whole room. Meaning no doors. The only separation between the toilet and room is a frosted glass door. Other than that, the rooms are super clean. Front desk were very accommodating. I do recommend! The only reason I state in the title "you get what you pay for" is because of the per night rate ($150.00+), a lil more than I would pay normally, but because I split the cost with my friend, it wasn't too bad.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were in Miami over the weekend starting April 5, 2013 and I was initially struck by the newness of Casa Moderna. Across the street from the American Airlines Arena, overlooking the Science Park and across the bay from South Beach, the location was ideal. But after a few hours at this 'boutique hotel' I began to feel like a guest at a friend's house. The attentive staff addressed us by name, the car was brought forth promptly and most important of all, even in such a high energy location our little world was remarkably peaceful. The pillows had been stuffed with exactly the right number of feathers, the chamber maids were invisible but their work impeccable. I feel like I want to go back there soon!
reviews.title: Quiet service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We travel to Miami very frequently and have stayed at many of the boutique hotels this is by far our favorite. I could move into the room for a month it is beautifully kept, very spacious, feels like home and the service is the finest. there is nothing they won't do for you. The restaurant and bar serves great food and they make everyone feel like royalty. you won't want to stay anywhere else!
reviews.title: Amazing hotel great space perfect service

reviews.text: Lorna runs the place and she is the best! She makes magic happen and always with a smile.
reviews.title: Stop at Amuse

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Vanessa at Amuse is a one of a kind bar person who really is interested in making the guests visit something special. She is awesome, stop by for a refreshment and she will concoct something very original for you.
reviews.title: Locals should enjoy their city too!

reviews.text: Overall, we had a nice time. This hotel tries really hard. The rooms are big and comfortable. The people are very friendly and helpful. If you have a car, it's a very central location. The spa and workout area was nice.
reviews.title: A lot to like. A little to be concerned with

reviews.text: But there are a couple of things to be aware of. The view of the water which could be beautiful is more of a view of a construction site as they redo the park. It was cold in Miami this week and there was also a pretty severe breeze at the pool - almost like you were in a wind tunnel. Finally, the hotel does not appear to be busy This is a plus and a minus. It's quiet but sometimes, too quiet.
reviews.title: I travel a great deal and have realistic expectations based on class of hotel.

reviews.text: Arrival was ok. With so many staff standing around 1 should cut down on the confusion and escort you to the 3rd floor reception desk. Check in was easy and they were very well prepared. I had called several times in advance and found the attitude to be well above average. Rooms are excellent. Clean, well designed, beautiful view, walk in closet, soaking tub next to your shower, etc...etc... One of the best jobs I've seen! New, modern, well thought out suites! Killer beds! Restaurant was hot! Like the ac was broke. One breakfast was enough for us. Food was good but temp was uncomfortable. Pool was cold yet they claim it was heated. We soaked in the not so hot hot tub. The other hot tub was hot! Towel service at the pool was a joke! Management must have a budget issue as they can't seem to keep clean towels at the pool. I rated the hotel a 4 out of 5 ONLY because I met some wonderful staff and for he most part believed they cared. Just have some bugs to work out...hopefully they do...as they left me feeling like I paid and they under delivered.
reviews.title: An Excellent Choice in Miami

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our 4th Stay at Casa Moderna. The previous 3 time the Hotel was operating under its former name (Tempo Miami), and we were hoping that things would remain at the previous high quality level: We were not disappointed. Check in is fast and comfortable. We enjoyed a Biscayne Suite for my wife and I, and a Deluxe room for my daughters.
reviews.title: We had high hopes before we arrived.

reviews.text: The biscayne suite is amazing, and though a little pricy, it was completely worth it. All the rooms in the hotel are comfortable, clean and well maintained. Staff is curteous and helpful. We ordered room service breakfast and it was delicous food, delivered promptly, and presented well.
reviews.title: First Class Gem

reviews.text: All us perfect. Room view pool whirlpool and nobody. Realy Alone. M'y 3rd Time on this hôtel. Before it was thé tempo hôtel. 5 min from bayside downtown and America airline arena by walk. Miami south beach 5 min by car
reviews.title: Best place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms in Casa Moderna are special and with a view. Near a major street so traffic noise can be an issue if you leave your door open.
reviews.title: A Very NIce Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beds are great. Most of the building is made up of private condos.
reviews.title: Maybe but not now!

reviews.text: Very nice and huge rooms, modern hotel, very well located at the center of many attractions in the city. They won't tell you, but in the what's used to be a park right in front is now a construction site. If your room is on the front the front of the hotel on Biscayne Blvd, you'll hear the noises all night. We left after only one (very bad) night, so we don't have much else to say, but the facilities seemed very nice (pool and fitness). Service was so-so, and the configuration of the hotel is a bit weird (no lobby, parking and front desk on different levels) making the experience a bit cold.
reviews.title: Lots of lies

reviews.text: The valet lost the key to my friends car
reviews.title: Casa SCAM?

description: Casa Moderna Miami is located in the heart of downtown Miami at the crossroads of Miami's entertainment district and South Beach. Catch a game at American Airlines Arena, see a show at the Adrienne Arsht Center for the Performing Arts or stay at Casa Moderna before and after a cruise. With deluxe accommodations, a stylish lounge, 8,000 square foot Spa, fitness center and 14th floor sky pool deck; Casa Moderna Miami is quickly becoming the premier luxury hotel in Miami.
